item.description:
South Korean prosecutors have arrested and indicted the crypto market maker Jon Bur Kim (real surname: Park) on fresh “scam coin” charges.

The post S Korean Prosecutors Arrest Top Crypto Market Maker on Fresh ‘Scam Coin’ Wrap appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Coinbase to Launch 24/7 Bitcoin and Ethereum Futures via CFTC-Regulated Exchange
item.description:
Coinbase plans to launch 24/7 Bitcoin and Ethereum futures trading via its CFTC-regulated derivatives exchange, aiming to align U.S. markets with global crypto trading norms and enhance risk management for traders.

The post Coinbase to Launch 24/7 Bitcoin and Ethereum Futures via CFTC-Regulated Exchange appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Michael Saylor’s Strategy to Sell $21 Billion In Preferred Stock
item.description:
Michael Saylor’s Strategy is issuing $21 billion in preferred stock to expand its Bitcoin reserves. This strategic move aligns with broader corporate shifts in digital asset financing amid regulatory uncertainties.

The post Michael Saylor’s Strategy to Sell $21 Billion In Preferred Stock appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: MyShell Terminates Market Maker Following Binance Scrutiny
item.description:
MyShell cut ties with a market maker after Binance flagged irregular trading activity involving the SHELL token. The company announced a buyback plan using liquidated stablecoins, pledged transparency, and confirmed collaboration with Binance to address concerns while maintaining operational stability.

The post MyShell Terminates Market Maker Following Binance Scrutiny appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Robinhood Settles US Regulator Probes with $30M Payment
item.description: Robinhood, has agreed to pay an astonishing $29.75 million to settle FINRA probes of its supervisory and compliance practices. Robinhood’s Regulatory Failures The deal follows a series of missteps that landed Robinhood in regulators’ crosshairs, such as anti-money laundering, supervisory, and customer protection rule breaches. item.title: Canada’s Newly Elected PM Mark Carney’s Past Bitcoin Criticisms Unearthed
item.description:
In a 2018 speech, former Bank of England chief Mark Carney cast doubt on Bitcoin's utility by critiquing its fixed design and potential economic effects. His observations, resurfacing amid shifting Canadian political landscapes, provided a retrospective look at cryptocurrency's role in fiscal policy.

The post Canada’s Newly Elected PM Mark Carney’s Past Bitcoin Criticisms Unearthed appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: CISA Adds Five Actively Exploited Vulnerabilities in Advantive VeraCore and Ivanti EPM to KEV List
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) on Monday added five security flaws impacting Advantive VeraCore and Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM) to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, based on evidence of active exploitation in the wild.
The list of vulnerabilities is as follows -

CVE-2024-57968 - An unrestricted file upload vulnerability in Advantive VeraCore
